name: Weiyan Shi
content: Weiyan Shi Weiyan Shi we.shi@northeastern.edu Google Scholar & Twitter ECE & Khoury Computer Science Northeastern University Home CHATS Lab Publications Teaching I am an assistant professor at Northeastern University, jointly appointed by ECE and Khoury Computer Science. I am broadly interested in NLP, Human-AI Interaction, and AI safety. Specifically, I investigate AI-driven persuasion, aiming to harness its societal benefits while mitigating its potential harm. Research Projects How AI Persuades Humans: PersuasionForGood, Cicero in Diplomacy, Anti-scam Chatbot, Movie Recommendation How to Persuade AI for Safety: Persuasive Jailbreaker, LLMs Encodes Harm and Refusal Separately AI's Societal Impact: Donation Persuasion, CultureBank Conversational AI: Learning through Interaction, User Sentiment Adaptation Privacy in AI: Selective Differential Privacy, Privacy Awareness in AI Agents News [2025.11] Honored to be recognized as an AI2050 Early Career Fellow! [2025.10] New paper on "Verbalized Sampling: How to Mitigate Mode Collapse and Unlock LLM Diversity" released! [2025.10] Another grant to build AI agents for coastal risk assessment awarded. Thanks, Massachusetts AI Hub! [2025.10] Two grants to advance AI safety supported by Open Philanthropy. Thanks so much! [2025.09] Paper on "LLMs Encode Harmfulness and Refusal Separately" accepted to NeurIPS. See you in San Diego! [2025.08] We are organizing the 1st Workshop on Multi-Turn Interactions in Large Language Models at NeurIPS. Thanks to our sponsor, Meta and Orby AI, we offer free student workshop registration.
